Reason: The configuration option _clock is performance-sensitive. The code context shows that the _clock configuration directly affects the type of TransactionPublisher returned, which in turn impacts the system performance. Depending on the value of _remoteServerIpAddress, either a ClientPublisher or CentralPublisher is returned, leading to different performance characteristics. The method clock() also plays a role in determining the Clock object used, potentially introducing further performance variations. Overall, the configuration _clock has a direct and substantial impact on system performance at the system level.
